means: 使凝结，冻结( congeal的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: This congealed muck was interfering with the filter.
sentence.Network_cn: 这团凝固的污物堵塞了过滤器。

sentence.Network_en: The cold remains of supper had congealed on the plate.
sentence.Network_cn: 晚餐剩下的冷饭菜已经凝结在盘子上了。

sentence.Network_en: The oil at last is congealed into a white fat.
sentence.Network_cn: 那油最终凝结成了一种白色的油脂.

1. 凝固体congealed　冻结的；凝结的congealed water　冷凝液

我司一国外客户紧急求购石蜡,具体要求如下: 色度(color point):28～30(saybolt) 凝点(congealing point):58～60°C 25°C时渗透:大约4～7 CAS NO:8002-74.

entry.def: When a liquid congeals, it becomes very thick and sticky and almost solid.

example.ex: The blood had started to congeal.

example.tran: 洒出来的酒混合着已变稠的汤

means.word_mean: 1. congealed into jelly; solidified by cooling;
